Program Information:
--------------------
Title: Multi-Browser Viewer
Version: 3.0.2.0
Year: 2010
Platform: Microsoft Windows XP, Vista or 7
Language: Multi
Medicine: crack

Multi-Browser Viewer - This tool will show you how to actually be displayed or that the site in that browser. The program consists of 22 self-contained virtual browser, and 5 autonomous mobile browser simulators. Program suitable as a normal user, and web designer, web developer or webmaster to check sites for compatibility with most browsers.
Features:
. 22 autonomous virtual browser - launching in 1922 of real web browsers on one computer! Running IE6, IE7 and IE8, Firefox 2, 3, 3.5 & 3.6, Opera 7.5, 8.5, 9.6,10 & 10.5, etc. on one computer
. 5 autonomous mobile browsers - includes 5 autonomous virtual mobile simulators, which makes it easy to test the website for the leading mobile browsers.
. iPhone and iPad Mobile Safari browser for Windows
. It is useful to any web designer, web developer or webmaster
. Spell check any web page
. HTML validation and automatic correction
. Work on the network
. Built-in HTML Validator
. AutoCorrect Options
. Multilingual support
and much more ...

. 22 Standalone Virtualized Browsers
Run 22 real web browsers on the same machine! Our virtual application technology allows you to run IE6, IE7 and IE8 on the same machine, side by side for example. Ideal for cross browser testing or for "locked down" corporate machines that aren't allowed to run the latest browsers by their security administrators.

. 5 Standalone Mobile Browsers or Simulators
With more and more people accessing the web from their smart phones like Apple's iPhone & iPad and Google's Android, it is becoming increasingly important to ensure your web site works correctly on all major mobile web browsers. Traditionally it has been a time consuming and a difficult task to set up individual mobile simulators. Multi-Browser Viewer now includes five standalone virtualized mobile simulators, enabling you to seamlessly test your web site on the leading mobile browsers.

. Exclusive: iPhone and iPad Mobile Safari Browser Simulator for Windows
Multi-Browser Viewer v3 is also the only cross browser testing software solution that includes a fully featured iPhone and iPad browser simulator for Windows, which have been developed using the same underlying Webkit rendering engine to give you an excellent indication of what your website will look like on an actual Apple iPhone or iPad device using the Mobile Safari browser. The iPhone and iPad Mobile Safari simulators for windows include all the functionality required to fully test your mobile web site, including Zoom functionality, a customizable User agent, HTML page source view as well as Portrait or Landscape view.

. 61 Screen Capture Image browsers
Multi-Browser Viewer has widest range of traditional screenshot testing browsers available, with 13 Mac browsers, 29 Windows browsers and 19 Linux browsers. Load any publicly accessible URL in any of the more than 60 web browsers. A full page, high quality screenshot is then taken and saved locally on your machine, where you can identify any potential rendering errors using Multi-Browser Viewer's "Compare Images" function. By default all screenshot images are taken at 1024px wide and saved in PNG format in a time stamped folder - "My Documents \ Multi-Browser Viewer"

. Screenshot Comparison Function ("Onion Skin" or "Side-by-Side")
As a designer you want to ensure that your design is pixel perfect. Multi-Browser Viewer's screenshot comparison feature, enables you to place any two screenshots conveniently next to each other or can be overlaid on top of each other. A slider bar and other filter views allows you to clearly see any differences in the rendered page.

. HTML Source Code and Webpage Archive (MHT) Automatically Saved
Multi-Browser Viewer also saves a copy of your HTML source code and a webpage archive file in a time stamped folder for each new testing session.

. Spell Check any Webpage
Now you can easily spell check the completed webpage to see if any spelling errors were missed during the final stages of your development. The spell checker supports four languages - English, Spanish, German and French. The spell checker also has a custom dictionary, which enables you to add any custom words to your spell checking library.

. Multi-Language Support
Multi-Browser Viewer has now been translated and is available in five languages, including English, Spanish, German, French and Russian.

. HTML and Webpage Comparison between two dates
Multi-Browser Viewer's new compare HTML function allows you to see exactly how the HTML source code has changed over time for a particular URL. The function highlights any different HTML code and it is conveniently displayed side-by-side. Furthermore using the "Browse" function you can recall any previously saves images, HTML source code and saved web pages (MHT files).

. HTML Validation and Auto-Correction
The validation and auto-correct function conveniently highlight any potential HTML problems, which could be causing cross browser rendering issues.

. Browser and Application Auto-Update Feature
Multi-Browser Viewer automatically prompts you for any browser or application updates, which are conveniently downloaded from within the application itself. Similarly, if you don't have a standalone browser locally on your machine yet, it is automatically downloaded for you when you need it.

. Other user friendly functions
Multi-Browser Viewer has many other convenient functions making your browser compatibility testing as productive as possible. Some of these include:
Right Click, Copy function - copies the entire high resolution image to your clipboard for use in your image editing applications like Adobe Photoshop.
Re-Request any individual image, without having to re-request the entire group of screenshot images.
Customize your application with six different themes.
Minimize and silently run the application in the background, when a particular job has finished a small notification will pop up in the bottom right hand corner of your screen.

Supported browsers (Standalone Web browsers included)
- Firefox 2, 3, 3.5 & 3.6
- Google Chrome 2, 3, 4 & 5
- Opera 9.64, 10 & 10.5
- Internet Explorer 6, 6Alt, 7 & 8
- Avant 11.7 Maxthon 2.5
- Safari 3.2, 4 and 5
- Seamonkey 2
- Flock 2.5

Autonomous mobile browsers enabled
- IPhone Mobile Safari Browser for Windows Simulator
- Blackberry Storm2 Browser Emulator
- Windows Mobile 6.5 Browser Emulator
- Google Android 2.1
- IPad Mobile Safari Browser for Windows Simulator
